ccre.channel

Interface SerialInput

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    SerialIO

    public interface SerialInput
    An interface to read from a generic serial input. Usually RS232. WARNING: THIS INTERFACE IS SUBJECT TO NON-BACKWARDS-COMPATIBLE CHANGE.
    Author:
    skeggsc

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close the serial port.
      byte[] readBlocking(int max)
      Read a byte array in a possibly-blocking manner, up to the given number of bytes.
      byte[] readNonblocking(int max)
      Read a byte array in a nonblocking manner, up to the given number of bytes.
      void setTermination(java.lang.Character end)
      Set the termination character - read operations will be ended early where these characters are found.

    • Method Detail

      • setTermination

        void setTermination(java.lang.Character end)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Set the termination character - read operations will be ended early where these characters are found.
        Parameters:
        end - the character to end read operations on, or null to not end early.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the termination cannot be set.

      • readBlocking

        byte[] readBlocking(int max)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Read a byte array in a possibly-blocking manner, up to the given number of bytes.
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        the read bytes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the bytes.

      • readNonblocking

        byte[] readNonblocking(int max)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Read a byte array in a nonblocking manner, up to the given number of bytes.
        Parameters:
        max - the maxmimum number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        the read bytes. this could be zero bytes, if non were promptly available!
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the bytes.

      • close

        void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the serial port. It may not be used after this is invoked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while the port was being closed.
